intro: Hieracium betuletorum, commonly known as the birch hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges, often near birch trees. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. Hieracium betuletorum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
